events.name: inputFocus
events.comment: This variable stores what the player is currently controlling.

actions.text: Wait a little before letting the player close the tutorial.

children.text: Close the tutorial and start the game when the player presses a key or taps the screen.
Vines move until they are too far to the left, then they teleport back to the right, to generate the illusion of unlimited vines.
Player is making a vertical input.
Player must be holding a vine to perform a jump.

actions.text: After jumping, the player is no longer holding a vine.

children.text: Make the player swing with the vine that they are currently holding.
Check if player went out of bounds. If that's the case, it's game over.
Check if the player fell into the water. If that's the case, spawn particles, wait a bit and call game over.

parameters: "deciding to check out the local aquatic life."

children.text: Player moves forward and falls when not holding a vine (performed a jump).
If the player is jumping and their hands collide with a vine, attach the player to the vine. This is considered a successful jump.

actions.text: Update successful jumps counter and UI.

children.text: If the player collides with a bird, it's game over.

parameters: "a bird took me on a trip."

children.text: If the player collides with a dolphin, it's game over.

parameters: "a dolphin took me on a trip."

children.text: Periodically create bubble particles, which are used to telegraph a dolphin spawn.

actions.text: Make dolphin emerge from the water, then dive again.

children.text: Destroy dolphin and spawn water particles.

children.name: birdType
children.comment: Type of the bird to spawn.

children.text: If bird is too far to the left, destroy it.
Snapshot and format current game state, then add share decorations.

functionParameters.name: textToDisplay
functionParameters.comment: Text to be displayed in the text box

actions.text: Set DrawingCanvas and other UI elements position.
Paste relevant in-game objects into the DrawingCanvas.
Set TextShare and paste decorations into the DrawingCanvas.

children.text: Stop everything and show game over screen.

children.functionDescription: Stop everything and show game over screen

functionParameters.name: gameOverCause
functionParameters.comment: Why is the game showing the game over screen?

parameters: "I made [b]" & successfulJumps & " successful jump" & (successfulJumps = 1 ? "" : "s") & "[/b] before " & gameOverCause & newline & "[b]Think you can beat my score?[/b]"

actions.text: Share score using previously saved game snapshot.

parameters.text: "Think you can beat my score at Jungle Master?"
parameters.title: "Jungle Master"
